reference.title: AArch64 PMU registers
reference.shortdesc: This chapter describes the AArch64 PMU registers and shows examples of how to use them.

link.desc: The PMU counters and their associated control registers are accessible in the AArch64 Execution state with MRS and MSR instructions.

link.linktext: PMCEID0_EL0, Performance Monitors Common Event Identification Register 0, EL0 (Ares/Enyo specific)
link.desc: The PMCEID0_EL0 defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events are implemented.

link.linktext: PMCEID1_EL0, Performance Monitors Common Event Identification Register 1, EL0 (Ares/Enyo Specific)
link.desc: The PMCEID1_EL0 defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events are implemented.

link.linktext: PMCR_EL0, Performance Monitors Control Register, EL0
link.desc: The PMCR_EL0 provides details of the Performance Monitors implementation, including the number of counters implemented, and configures and controls the counters.
